summary.p: Sends a letter from Melanchthon. Together with Grynaeus, he negotiated in Strasbourg about the [Wittenberg Concord] and received an acceptable response, but cannot write in detail now; he wants to arrange for the people of Zurich to be informed by Grynaeus either in writing or orally.

div.p: Greetings. In this letter, you will find, I believe, a letter from Melanchthon.

Grynaeus and I were in Strasbourg; we attempted to negotiate the articles of concord and common peace of the churches. We conversed and elicited a response which, in my judgment, is both tolerable and will have significant weight towards peace. However, I do not have the time to write more fully now, as I must report on the proceedings there, and that today after lunch. I will urge Dr. Grynaeus to write everything, and I am entirely committed to ensuring that it is sent to you to explain everything. Please consider these few words kindly.
To the most learned man, Dr. Heinrich Bullinger, the primary pastor in Zurich, his most esteemed superior.
